reference.title: Columns in the ResultSets returned by getFunctionColumns and getProcedureColumns

section.p: Columns in the ResultSets returned by getFunctionColumns and getProcedureColumns are as described by the API.
The following table shows -specific details for some specific columns returned by getFunctionColumns.

table.title: Columns in the ResultSet returned by getFunctionColumns
table.desc: This table lists and describes -specific details for some columns in the ResultSet returned by the getFunctionColumns method.

row.entry: A short indicating what the row describes. Is always DatabaseMetaData.functionColumnIn if it represents a parameter; DatabaseMetaData.functionReturn if it represents a return value; and DatabaseMetaData.functionColumnResult if it represents a column in a table function.
A String which describes the Java type of the method parameter.
The ordinal position, starting from 1, for the input and output parameters for the function.

section.p: The following table shows -specific details for some specific columns returned by getProcedureColumns.

table.title: Columns in the ResultSet returned by getProcedureColumns
table.desc: This table lists and describes -specific details for some columns in the ResultSet returned by the getProcedureColumns methods.

row.entry: A short indicating what the row describes. Is always DatabaseMetaData.procedureColumnIn if the parameter is (possibly implicitly) declared as an IN parameter; DatabaseMetaData.procedureColumnInOut if the parameter is declared as an INOUT parameter; and DatabaseMetaData.procedureColumnOut if the parameter is declared as an OUT parameter.
A String which describes the Java type of the method parameter.
The ordinal position, starting from 1, for the input and output parameters for the procedure.
